revision.text:
{{Use British English|date=June 2013}} {{Use dmy dates|date=June 2013}} {{Infobox football biography |name = Nahki Wells |image = Nahki Wells.jpg |image_size = 200 |caption = Wells playing for [[Huddersfield Town A.F.C.|Huddersfield Town]] in 2015 |fullname = Nahki Michael Wells{{cite web |url=http://www.bdfutbol.com/en/j/j25372.html |title=Wells: Nahki Michael Wells: Player |publisher=BDFutbol |accessdate=31 December 2017}} |birth_date = {{birth date and age|1990|6|1|df=y}}{{cite web |title=Nahki Wells |url=http://hugmansfootballers.com/player/25718 |work=Barry Hugman's Footballers |accessdate=19 March 2016}} |birth_place = [[Hamilton, Bermuda|Hamilton]], Bermuda |height = 1.70 m{{cite web |title=N. Wells |url=https://uk.soccerway.com/players/nahki-wells/170326/ |work=Soccerway |publisher=Perform Group |accessdate=26 December 2017}} |position = [[Forward (association football)|Forward]] |currentclub = [[Queens Park Rangers F.C.|Queens Park Rangers]]
(on loan from [[Burnley F.C.|Burnley]]) |clubnumber = 32 |youthyears1 = 2002–2009 |youthclubs1 = [[Dandy Town Hornets F.C.|Dandy Town Hornets]] |years1 = 2009–2010 |clubs1 = [[Dandy Town Hornets F.C.|Dandy Town Hornets]] |caps1 = |goals1 = 20 |years2 = 2010 |clubs2 = [[Bermuda Hogges F.C.|Bermuda Hogges]] |caps2 = 9 |goals2 = 2 |years3 = 2010–2011 |clubs3 = [[Eccleshill United F.C.|Eccleshill United]] |caps3 = |goals3 = |years4 = 2011 |clubs4 = [[Carlisle United F.C.|Carlisle United]] |caps4 = 3 |goals4 = 0 |years5 = 2011–2014 |clubs5 = [[Bradford City A.F.C.|Bradford City]] |caps5 = 91 |goals5 = 42 |years6 = 2014 |clubs6 = → [[Huddersfield Town A.F.C.|Huddersfield Town]] (loan) |caps6 = 1 |goals6 = 1 |years7 = 2014–2017 |clubs7 = [[Huddersfield Town A.F.C.|Huddersfield Town]] |caps7 = 143 |goals7 = 44 |years8 = 2017– |clubs8 = [[Burnley F.C.|Burnley]] |caps8 = 9 |goals8 = 0 |years9 = 2018– |clubs9 = → [[Queens Park Rangers F.C.|Queens Park Rangers]] (loan) |caps9 = 31 |goals9 = 6 |nationalyears1 = 2007– |nationalteam1 = [[Bermuda national football team|Bermuda]] |nationalcaps1 = 10 |nationalgoals1 = 6 |club-update = 09:02, 3 March 2019 (UTC) |nationalteam-update = 00:36, 29 November 2018 (UTC) }} '''Nahki Michael Wells''' (born 1 June 1990) is a Bermudian professional [[association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Forward (association football)|forward]] for [[Queens Park Rangers F.C.|Queens Park Rangers]], on loan from [[Burnley F.C.|Burnley]], and the [[Bermuda national football team|Bermuda national team]]. Wells began his career in his native Bermuda, playing for [[Dandy Town Hornets F.C.|Dandy Town Hornets]] and [[Bermuda Hogges F.C.|Bermuda Hogges]]. After moving to England, where he had a brief spell in non-league football with [[Eccleshill United F.C.|Eccleshill United]], Wells has since played in [[the Football League]] for [[Carlisle United F.C.|Carlisle United]], [[Bradford City A.F.C.|Bradford City]] and Huddersfield Town. ==Club career== ===Early career=== Wells was born in [[Hamilton, Bermuda|Hamilton]]. He began his career in his native Bermuda with the [[Dandy Town Hornets F.C.|Dandy Town Hornets]],{{cite web|url=http://www.thetelegraphandargus.co.uk/sport/sportbcfc/11049034.Bradford_City_awaiting_Bermudian_bill_for_Wells/|title=Bradford City awaiting Bermudian bill for Nahki Wells|date=4 March 2014|accessdate=4 March 2014|author=Simon Parker|publisher=Telegraph & Argus}} a team he had first joined at the age of 12.{{cite web|url=http://www.carlisleunited.co.uk/page/ProfilesDetail/0,,10361~54782,00.html|title=Player profile|accessdate=12 February 2011|publisher=Carlisle United F.C. official website|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110119062748/http://www.carlisleunited.co.uk/page/ProfilesDetail/0,,10361~54782,00.html|archivedate=19 January 2011|df=dmy-all}} Wells had a trial with Dutch club [[AFC Ajax|Ajax]] as a teenager; he was offered a contract but ultimately did not sign for the club.{{cite web|url=http://www.thetelegraphandargus.co.uk/sport/sportbcfc/10237594.Ajax_loss_was_Bradford_City_gain_on_Wells_signing/|title=Ajax loss was Bradford City gain on Nahki Wells signing|date=20 February 2013|author=Simon Parker|work=Telegraph & Argus}} After spending the 2009–10 season with the senior team of the Dandy Town Hornets, scoring 20 goals,{{cite web|url=http://www.rsssf.com/tablesb/berm2010.html|title=Bermuda 2009/10|accessdate=21 December 2010|publisher=Rec.Sport.Soccer Statistics Foundation}} Wells spent the 2010 season in the [[USL PDL]] with the [[Bermuda Hogges F.C.|Bermuda Hogges]], scoring 2 goals in 9 games.{{NFT player |id=31769 |name=Wells, Nahki |accessdate=14 January 2018}}{{cite web|url=http://www.uslsoccer.com/teams/2010/roster/6188091.html|title=Bermuda Hogges 2010 Roster|publisher=United Soccer Leagues|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121024041535/http://www.uslsoccer.com/teams/2010/roster/6188091.html|archivedate=24 October 2012|df=dmy-all}} Wells later moved to England to attend the [[Richmond, The American International University in London#Richmond Soccer Academy and Italian Study Centers|Richmond International Academic & Soccer Academy]] in Leeds, and also played club football with local non-League team [[Eccleshill United F.C.|Eccleshill United]].{{cite web|url=http://www.thetelegraphandargus.co.uk/sport/sportbcfc/10194781.Bradford_City_striker_Wells_a_guest_of_Eccleshill_United/|title=Bradford City striker Nahki Wells a guest of Eccleshill United|date=30 January 2013|author=Ian Whiting|work=Telegraph & Argus}}{{cite web|url=http://www.thetelegraphandargus.co.uk/sport/sportbcfc/10294126.Wells_sets_Eccleshill_United_standard/|title=Nahki Wells sets Eccleshill United standard|date=15 March 2013|author=Ian Whiting|work=Telegraph & Argus}} Wells underwent a trial with [[Carlisle United F.C.|Carlisle United]] in November 2010,{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/teams/c/carlisle_united/9232086.stm|title=Bermuda striker Nahki Wells lands Carlisle trial|accessdate=21 December 2010|date=26 November 2010|publisher=BBC Sport}} his second with the club.{{cite news|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/teams/carlisle-united/8216487/Cumbrians-snap-up-Wells.html|title=Cumbrians snap up Wells|accessdate=21 December 2010|date=21 December 2010|work=The Telegraph|location=London}} Before moving to the UK, Well has sought the advice of compatriot [[Shaun Goater]].{{cite web|url=http://www.mediafire.com/?t57259hha3qf1qp|title=Goater feeds ambition of Bradford City striker Nahki Wells|accessdate=20 September 2011|date=20 September 2011|author=Simon Parker|work=Telegraph & Argus}}{{dead link|date=March 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} In December 2010, it was announced that Wells would sign for Carlisle United on 1 January 2011.{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/teams/c/carlisle_united/9308830.stm|title=Bermuda striker Nahki Wells to join Carlisle United United|accessdate=21 December 2010|date=21 December 2010|publisher=BBC Sport}} Wells made his debut for Carlisle United on 15 January 2011, in a [[EFL League One|League One]] game against [[Bristol Rovers F.C.|Bristol Rovers]].{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_div_2/9359337.stm|title=Carlisle 4 – 0 Bristol Rovers|accessdate=12 February 2011|date=15 January 2011|publisher=BBC Sport}} In March 2011, Wells publicly announced his wish to play at [[Wembley Stadium]] with Carlisle United in the [[2011 Football League Trophy Final]], to be played in April 2011.{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/teams/c/carlisle_united/9410919.stm|title=Bermuda striker Wells aims for Wembley with Carlisle|accessdate=1 March 2011|date=1 March 2011|publisher=BBC Sport}} However, Wells did not make the matchday squad, as Carlisle United beat [[Brentford F.C.|Brentford]] 1–0.{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/9443308.stm|title=Brentford 0 – 1 Carlisle|accessdate=3 April 2011|date=3 April 2011|publisher=BBC Sport|first=Stephan|last=Shemilt}} On 3 May 2011, it was announced that Wells' contract with Carlisle United would not be renewed at the end of the season.{{cite web|url=http://www.carlisleunited.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0,,10361~2352147,00.html|title=Decisions Made on Two|accessdate=3 May 2011|date=3 May 2011|publisher=Carlisle United F.C.|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20111004110022/http://www.carlisleunited.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0,,10361~2352147,00.html|archivedate=4 October 2011|df=dmy-all}}{{cite web|url=http://bermudasun.bm/main.asp?SectionID=8&SubSectionID=203&ArticleID=51871|title=Wells contract not renewed by Carlisle|accessdate=3 May 2011|date=3 May 2011|publisher=Bermunda Sun}} ===Bradford City=== ====2011–12 season==== In late June 2011, Wells went on trial with [[Bradford City A.F.C.|Bradford City]] alongside four other players.{{cite web|url=http://www.bradfordcityfc.co.uk/page/News/0,,10266~2382537,00.html|title=Five on trial|accessdate=27 June 2011|date=27 June 2011|publisher=Bradford City A.F.C.|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120327091239/http://www.bradfordcityfc.co.uk/page/News/0,,10266~2382537,00.html|archivedate=27 March 2012|df=dmy-all}}{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/13939127.stm|title=Bradford City take five players on pre-season trials|accessdate=28 June 2011|date=28 June 2011|publisher=BBC Sport}} He signed a one-year contract with Bradford City on 22 July 2011.{{cite web|url=http://www.bradfordcityfc.co.uk/page/News/0,,10266~2398636,00.html|title=Wells wins City contract|accessdate=22 July 2011|date=22 July 2011|publisher=Bradford City A.F.C.|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120905184324/http://www.bradfordcityfc.co.uk/page/News/0,,10266~2398636,00.html|archivedate=5 September 2012|df=dmy-all}}{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/teams/b/bradford_city/9545634.stm|title=Bradford City bring in striker Nahki Wells|accessdate=22 July 2011|date=22 July 2011|publisher=BBC Sport}} Wells made his debut for Bradford City on the opening day of the 2011–12 season, coming on as a 74th-minute substitute for [[Mark Stewart (footballer)|Mark Stewart]].[http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_div_3/14351989.stm "Bradford 1–2 Aldershot"] BBC Sport. 6 August 2011. Retrieved 8 January 2012. He scored his first goal for the Bantams in a 4–2 win against [[Barnet F.C.|Barnet]].[http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_div_3/14600527.stm "Bradford 4–2 Barnet"] BBC Sport. 27 August 2011. Retrieved 8 January 2012. On 9 March 2012, Bradford City exercised an option in Wells' contract, and extended his deal by one year.{{cite web|url=http://www.bradfordcityfc.co.uk/page/News/0,,10266~2642269,00.html|archive-url=https://archive.is/20120630224803/http://www.bradfordcityfc.co.uk/page/News/0,,10266~2642269,00.html|dead-url=yes|archive-date=30 June 2012|title=City take up Wells option|date=9 March 2012|publisher=Bradford City A.F.C.}} On 14 April, he scored a hat-trick as Bradford beat [[Northampton Town F.C.|Northampton Town]] 3–1.[https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/17643373 "Northampton 1–3 Bradford"] BBC Sport. 14 April 2012. Retrieved 14 April 2012. He was later named in the Football League Two Team of the Week for that week.[http://www.bradfordcityfc.co.uk/page/News/0,,10266~1784558,00.html "Wells named in FL Team of the Week"] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120228172424/http://www.bradfordcityfc.co.uk/page/News/0%2C%2C10266~1784558%2C00.html |date=28 February 2012 }} Bradford City F.C. 17 April 2012. Retrieved 17 April 2012. Following this, former Bradford City player [[Dean Windass]] urged Wells to remain with the club,{{cite web|url=http://www.thetelegraphandargus.co.uk/sport/sportbcfc/9659447.Don_t_be_in_a_hurry_to_leave_Bantams__Windass_advises_Wells/|title=Dean Windass advises Nahki Wells: Don't be in a hurry to leave Bradford City|date=20 April 2012|author=Simon Parker|work=Telegraph & Argus}} while ex-Bermudian international [[Kyle Lightbourne]] compared him to [[Jermain Defoe]].{{cite web|url=http://www.royalgazette.com/article/20120420/SPORT01/704209977|title=Wells has Defoe magic, says Lightbourne|date=20 April 2012|publisher=Royal Gazette}} In early May, Wells and Bradford City began discussions over a new four-year contract,{{cite web|url=http://www.thetelegraphandargus.co.uk/sport/sportbcfc/9683345.Bradford_City_keen_to_play_down_talk_of_Wells_quitting_club/|title=Bradford City confident of tieing up four-year Nahki Wells deal|author=Simon Parker|date=3 May 2012|work=Telegraph & Argus}} and later that month he publicly assured fans that he would stay with the club.{{cite web|url=http://www.thetelegraphandargus.co.uk/sport/sportbcfc/9706645.I___ll_be_a_Bradford_City_player_next_season__says_Wells/|title=Bradford City striker Nahki Wells will not let interest from 'big clubs' distract him|author=Simon Parker|date=16 May 2012|work=Telegraph & Argus}} In June there were further rumours of Wells leaving the club,{{cite web|url=http://www.thetelegraphandargus.co.uk/sport/sportbcfc/9740619.Wells_rumour_mill_grinds_away_but_Bradford_City_in_no_rush_for_an_answer/|title=Nahki Wells rumour mill grinds away but Bradford City in no rush for an answer|author=Simon Parker|date=2 June 2012|work=Telegraph & Argus}} while it was later revealed that he nearly never signed for the club in the first place.{{cite web|url=http://www.thetelegraphandargus.co.uk/sport/sportbcfc/9754447.Ellis_reveals_Wells_so_close_to_not_making_grade_at_Bradford_City/|title=Mark Ellis reveals Wells so close to not making grade at Bradford City|author=Simon Parker|date=12 June 2012|work=Telegraph & Argus}} In July, Wells stated he was in no rush to sign a new contract.{{cite web|url=http://www.thetelegraphandargus.co.uk/sport/sportbcfc/9845380.Bradford_City_striker_Wells_in_no_rush_over_contract_negotiations/|title=Bradford City striker Nahki Wells in no rush over contract negotiations|author=Simon Parker|date=31 July 2012|work=Telegraph & Argus}} ====2012–13 season==== [[File:Nahki Wells (Bradford City).jpg|thumb|right|Wells celebrating [[Bradford City A.F.C.|Bradford City's]] victory in the [[2013 Football League Two play-off Final|2013 League Two play-off Final]]]] Wells scored a penalty on the opening day of the 2012–13 season in an away match against [[Gillingham F.C.|Gillingham]].[https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/19221411 "Gillingham 3–1 Bradford"] BBC Sport. 18 August 2012. Retrieved 18 August 2012. He scored his second goal of the season on 25 August in a 5–1 win against [[AFC Wimbledon]], and also assisted the fifth goal, crossing for James Hanson to score with a header.[https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/19304428 "Bradford 5–1 AFC Wimbledon"] BBC Sport. 25 August 2012. Retrieved 25 August 2012. In September 2012, Wells suffered a hip injury.{{cite web|url=http://www.thetelegraphandargus.co.uk/sport/sportbcfc/9928357.Bradford_City__Wells_told_to_keep_calm_and_carry_on/|title=Bradford City: Nahki Wells told to keep calm and carry on|date=7 September 2012|author=Simon Parker|work=Telegraph & Argus}} On 25 September, Wells came off the bench to score two late goals to help Bradford overturn a 2–0 deficit against [[Burton Albion F.C.|Burton Albion]] in the [[EFL Cup|League Cup]] third round, with Bradford going on to win the game 3–2 in extra time.[https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/19632333 "Bradford 3–2 Burton"] BBC Sport. 25 September 2012. Retrieved 25 September 2012. At the end of September 2012, Wells signed a new three-year contract with the club,{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/19759223|title=Bradford City forward Nahki Wells signs new deal|date=28 September 2012|publisher=BBC Sport}}{{cite web|url=http://www.thetelegraphandargus.co.uk/sport/sportbcfc/9956004.Wells_puts_pen_to_paper_on_new_Bradford_City_deal/|title=Nahki Wells puts pen to paper on new Bradford City deal|author=Simon Parker|date=28 September 2012|work=Telegraph & Argus}} in a move praised by [[Phil Parkinson]], the club's manager.{{cite web|url=http://www.thetelegraphandargus.co.uk/sport/sportbcfc/9956376.Nahki_signing_a_big_deal_as_he_s_only_going_to_get_better__says_Bantams_boss/|title=Nahki Wells signing a big deal as he's only going to get better, says Bradford City boss Phil Parkinson|author=Simon Parker|date=29 September 2012|work=Telegraph & Argus}} In October 2012, Wells was banned by the club from celebrating his goals.{{cite web|url=http://www.thetelegraphandargus.co.uk/sport/sportbcfc/10008192.Bantams_bring_Wells_to_book_over_celebrations/|title=Bradford City bring Nahki Wells to book over celebrations|date=26 October 2012|author=Simon Parker|work=Telegraph & Argus}} As the January 2013 transfer window opened, Bradford City dismissed rumours linking Wells with a move away from the club.{{cite web|url=http://www.thetelegraphandargus.co.uk/sport/sportbcfc/10140245.Bradford_City_rubbish_Wells_transfer_rumours/|title=Bradford City rubbish Nahki Wells transfer rumours|date=4 January 2013|author=Simon Parker|work=Telegraph & Argus}} On 8 January 2013, he helped Bradford beat [[Premier League]] side [[Aston Villa F.C.|Aston Villa]] 3–1 in the first leg of the semi-final of the League Cup by opening the scoring in the 19th minute.{{cite web|url=http://www.thetelegraphandargus.co.uk/sport/sportbcfc/10148084.Wells_on_the_mark_as_Bradford_City_defy_odds_again/|title=Nahki Wells on the mark as Bradford City defy odds again|date=9 January 2013|work=Telegraph & Argus}} After appearing in the [[2013 Football League Cup Final|2013 League Cup Final]], Wells became the first player from Bermuda to appear in an English major cup final. Although Wells did not complete the game,{{cite web|url=http://www.thetelegraphandargus.co.uk/sport/sportbcfc/10250198.Wells_gutted_not_to_complete_final_for_Bradford_City/|title=Nahki Wells gutted not to complete final for Bradford City|date=26 February 2013|author=Simon Parker|work=Telegraph & Argus}} prior to the match he spoke about being motivated by the recent death of a friend in a motorcycle accident,{{cite web|url=http://www.thetelegraphandargus.co.uk/sport/sportbcfc/10246463.Friend___s_death_giving_Wells_extra_motivation_to_achieve_Bradford_City_ambitions/|title=Friend's death giving Nahki Wells extra motivation to achieve Bradford City ambitions|date=23 February 2013|author=Simon Parker|work=Telegraph & Argus}} as well as how he was looking forward to facing opponents from a higher league.{{cite web|url=http://www.thetelegraphandargus.co.uk/sport/sportbcfc/10246609.Star_Bradford_City_striker_thinks_he_is_destined_for_greatness/|title=Star Bradford City striker thinks he is destined for greatness|date=23 February 2013|author=Simon Parker|work=Telegraph & Argus}} Wells hadn't scored for the club since 2 February 2013,{{cite web|url=http://www.thetelegraphandargus.co.uk/sport/sportbcfc/10335148.Bradford_City_striker_Wells__I_ll_get_my_Nak_back_against_Cobblers/|title=Bradford City striker Wells: I'll get my Nak back against Northampton|date=5 April 2013|author=Simon Parker|work=Telegraph & Argus}} until he scored the only goal of the game on 6 April 2013, in a 1–0 home victory against Northampton Town.{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/21979701|title=Bradford 1–0 Northampton|date=6 April 2013|publisher=BBC Sport}} Later that month, he was linked with a transfer to [[Burnley F.C.|Burnley]].{{cite web|url=http://www.thetelegraphandargus.co.uk/sport/sportbcfc/10373858.Bradford_City_striker_Wells_watched_by_Burnley/|title=Bradford City striker Nahki Wells watched by Burnley|date=24 April 2013|author=Simon Parker|work=Telegraph & Argus}} In May 2013, Wells scored three goals across two legs to help Bradford City qualify for the League Two play-off final. The goals took his tally for the season to 25, a target he had set himself before the season begun.{{cite web|url=http://www.thetelegraphandargus.co.uk/sport/sportbcfc/10401252.Bradford_City_hero_Wells__I_m_saving_my_final_two_goals_of_season_for_Wembley/|title=Bradford City hero Nahki Wells: I'm saving my final two goals of season for Wembley|date=6 May 2013|author=Simon Parker|work=Telegraph & Argus}} He then scored in the final against Northampton Town, which Bradford won 3–0 to earn promotion to League One.[https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/22491339 "Bradford 3–0 Northampton"] BBC Sport. 18 May 2013. Retrieved 19 May 2013. Following the promotion, Wells stated he wished to stay at the club,{{cite web|url=http://www.thetelegraphandargus.co.uk/sport/sportbcfc/10429067.Wells_pledges_future_to_Bantams_after_promotion_success/|title=Nahki Wells: I'm going nowhere!|date=18 May 2013|author=Ross Heppenstall|work=Telegraph & Argus}} though the club later admitted they might sell the player if a suitable offer came in.{{cite web|url=http://www.thetelegraphandargus.co.uk/sport/sportbcfc/10429454.Bradford_City_hot_shot_Wells_could_be_sold_to_highest_bidder/|title=Nahki Wells under contract but Bradford City boss Phil Parkinson admits he is 'ready to field phone calls'|date=20 May 2013|author=Simon Parker|work=Telegraph & Argus}} Former City player [[John Hendrie (Scottish footballer)|John Hendrie]] advised Wells to remain at the club.{{cite web|url=http://www.thetelegraphandargus.co.uk/sport/sportbcfc/10443104.Bradford_City__Hendrie_advises_Wells_to_stay_put/|title=Bradford City: John Hendrie advises Nahki Wells to stay put|date=25 May 2013|author=Simon Parker|work=Telegraph & Argus}} ====2013–14 season==== Ahead of the 2013–14 season, Wells spoke of his desire for another good cup run,{{cite web|url=http://www.thetelegraphandargus.co.uk/sport/sportbcfc/10488000.Bradford_City_striker_Wells_up_for_another_tilt_at_Wembley/|title=Bradford City striker Nahki Wells up for another tilt at Wembley|date=17 June 2013|author=Simon Parker|publisher=Telegraph & Argus}} and his belief that the club could achieve a second successive promotion.{{cite web|url=http://www.thetelegraphandargus.co.uk/sport/sportbcfc/10572305.We_have_a_real_shot_at_double_promotion__says_Bradford_City_striker_Wells/|title=We have a real shot at double promotion, says Bradford City striker Nahki Wells|date=26 July 2013|author=Simon Parker|publisher=Telegraph & Argus}} In June 2012, manager Phil Parkinson said that only a high-money bid would persuade the club to sell either Wells or fellow striker [[James Hanson (footballer born 1987)|James Hanson]].{{cite web|url=http://www.thetelegraphandargus.co.uk/sport/sportbcfc/10502613.Bradford_City___Stupid__bids_only_for_crown_jewels_Wells_and_Hanson/|title=Bradford City: 'Stupid' bids only for crown jewels Nahki Wells and James Hanson|date=24 June 2013|author=Simon Parker|publisher=Telegraph & Argus}} In July 2013, the club rejected a bid from [[Peterborough United F.C.|Peterborough United]],{{cite web|url=http://www.thetelegraphandargus.co.uk/sport/sportbcfc/10537969.Bradford_City_reject_bid_for_Wells/|title=Bradford City reject bid for Nahki Wells|date=10 July 2013|author=Simon Parker|publisher=Telegraph & Argus}} and later revealed that they had had no further offers for the player.{{cite web|url=http://www.thetelegraphandargus.co.uk/sport/sportbcfc/10601936.All_quiet_on_Bradford_City_frontman_Wells/|title=All quiet on Bradford City frontman Nahki Wells|date=9 August 2013|accessdate=10 August 2013|author=Simon Parker|publisher=Telegraph & Argus}} In August 2013, Wells' strike partner Hanson spoke positively of his partnership with Wells.{{cite web|url=http://www.thetelegraphandargus.co.uk/sport/sportbcfc/10601939.Bradford_City_strike_pair_One_to_watch/|title=Bradford City strike pair James Hanson and Nahki Wells One to watch|date=9 August 2013|accessdate=10 August 2013|author=Simon Parker|publisher=Telegraph & Argus}} On 24 August 2013, Wells scored two goals in a home match against Sheffield United; in the process he set a new club record by scoring in his eighth consecutive match, a feat which was praised by teammate James Hanson.{{cite web|url=http://www.thetelegraphandargus.co.uk/sport/sportbcfc/10633834.Hanson_thrilled_to_play_alongside_record_breaking_Bradford_City_forward_partner_Wells/|title=James Hanson thrilled to play alongside record-breaking Bradford City forward partner Nahki Wells|date=26 August 2013|accessdate=27 August 2013|author=Simon Parker|publisher=Telegraph & Argus}} After the match the club re-stated that they would not sell Wells,{{cite web|url=http://www.thetelegraphandargus.co.uk/sport/sportbcfc/10633630.Parkin__Bradford_City_won_t_sell_Wells/|title=Parkin: Bradford City won't sell Wells|date=24 August 2013|accessdate=24 August 2013|author=Simon Parker|publisher=Telegraph & Argus}}{{cite web|url=http://www.thetelegraphandargus.co.uk/sport/sportbcfc/10636891.Wells_is_going_nowhere__insists_Bradford_City_boss/|title=Nahki Wells is going nowhere, insists Bradford City boss Phil Parkinson|date=28 August 2013|accessdate=2 September 2013|author=Simon Parker|publisher=Telegraph & Argus}}{{cite web|url=http://www.thetelegraphandargus.co.uk/sport/sportbcfc/10642811.Bradford_City_strike_sensation_Wells_staying__cool__amid_transfer_hype/|title=Bradford City strike sensation Nahki Wells staying 'cool' amid transfer hype|date=30 August 2013|accessdate=2 September 2013|author=Simon Parker|publisher=Telegraph & Argus}} and later confirmed they had not received any bids for the player on transfer deadline day.{{cite web|url=http://www.thetelegraphandargus.co.uk/sport/sportbcfc/10647671.Bradford_City__We_ve_had_no_Wells_bids_today/|title=Bradford City: We've had no Wells bids today|date=2 September 2013|accessdate=2 September 2013|publisher=Telegraph & Argus}} On 4 September 2013, Wells was nominated for the League One Player of the Month award,{{cite web|url=http://www.thetelegraphandargus.co.uk/sport/sportbcfc/10652473.Wells_nominated_for_Football_League_prize/|title=Bradford City striker Nahki Wells nominated for Football League prize|date=4 September 2013|accessdate=4 September 2013|author=Simon Parker|publisher=Telegraph & Argus}} winning the award two days later.{{cite web|url=http://www.thetelegraphandargus.co.uk/sport/sportbcfc/10658455.Bantams_award_winner_Wells__Team_the_real_prize_guys/|title=Bantams League One player of month Nahki Wells says team the real prize guys|date=6 September 2013|accessdate=6 September 2013|author=Simon Parker|publisher=Telegraph & Argus}} Wells has publicly praised his strike partnership with Hanson,{{cite web|url=http://www.thetelegraphandargus.co.uk/sport/sportbcfc/10671292.Bantams_hitman_Wells_on_why_he_and_Hanson_are_such_a_striking_combination/|title=Bantams hitman Nahki Wells gives the lowdown on why he and James Hanson are such a striking combination|date=13 September 2013|accessdate=13 September 2013|author=Simon Parker|publisher=Telegraph & Argus}} as has journalist Simon Parker, who described them as "[one of] the best front pairs that League One has to offer."{{cite web|url=http://www.thetelegraphandargus.co.uk/sport/sportbcfc/10816720.Bradford_City__Wells_plus_Hanson_equals_must_see_TV/|title=Bradford City: Nahki Wells plus James Hanson equals must-see TV|date=19 November 2013|accessdate=19 November 2013|author=Simon Parker|publisher=Telegraph & Argus}} Of the 53 goals that Wells scored for Bradford City, 49 came when he was playing with Hanson.{{cite web|url=http://www.thetelegraphandargus.co.uk/sport/sportbcfc/10932591.Bradford_City__Death_of_a_double_act_but_Hanson_looks_to_the_future/|title=Bradford City: Death of a double act but James Hanson looks to the future after Nahki Wells departure|date=14 January 2014|accessdate=15 January 2014|author=Andrew Davies|publisher=Telegraph & Argus}} In late September 2013 Wells suffered ankle ligament damage in a match, and was ruled out for a number of weeks.{{cite web|url=http://www.thetelegraphandargus.co.uk/sport/sportbcfc/10709385.Nahki_Wells_suffers_ankle_ligament_damage/|title=Nahki Wells suffers ankle ligament damage|date=1 October 2013|accessdate=1 October 2013|author=Simon Parker|publisher=Telegraph & Argus}} Manager Phil Parkinson stated he would not rush Wells back into play,{{cite web|url=http://www.thetelegraphandargus.co.uk/sport/sportbcfc/10751072.Bradford_City_boss_Parkinson_will_not_rush_Wells__comeback/|title=Bradford City boss Phil Parkinson will not rush Nahki Wells' comeback|date=21 October 2013|accessdate=24 October 2013|author=Simon Parker|publisher=Telegraph & Argus}} Wells returned, after two months out, to score a hat-trick against Coventry City.{{cite web|url=http://www.thetelegraphandargus.co.uk/sport/sportbcfc/10815306.Wells_helps_Bradford_City_see_the_light/|title=Nahki Wells helps Bradford City see the light|date=18 November 2013|accessdate=18 November 2013|author=Simon Parker|publisher=Telegraph & Argus}} In December 2013, club co-chairman [[Julian Rhodes]] admitted that the player might leave the club,{{cite web|url=http://www.thetelegraphandargus.co.uk/sport/sportbcfc/10852569.Chances_of_signing_Bradford_City_striker_Wells_on_new_long_term_deal_unlikely__admits_Rhodes/|title=Chances of signing Bradford City striker Nahki Wells on new long-term deal unlikely, admits Julian Rhodes|date=4 December 2013|accessdate=4 December 2013|author=Simon Parker|publisher=Telegraph & Argus}} as rumours surrounding the player's possible departure began to increase.{{cite web|url=http://www.thetelegraphandargus.co.uk/sport/sportbcfc/10860925.Wells_rumour_mill_set_to_go_into_overdrive_but_Bantams_just_being_shrewd_in_keeping_bases_open/|title=Nahki Wells rumour mill set to go into overdrive but Bantams just being shrewd in keeping their bases open|date=7 December 2013|accessdate=8 December 2013|author=Simon Parker|publisher=Telegraph & Argus}} That same month, colleague Andrew Davies described Wells and Hanson as the best strike pair in the division,{{cite web|url=http://www.thetelegraphandargus.co.uk/sport/sportbcfc/10858057.Wells_and_Hanson_a_deadly_double_act_for_Bradford_City/|title=Nahki Wells and James Hanson a deadly double act for Bradford City|date=6 December 2013|accessdate=8 December 2013|author=Andrew Davies|publisher=Telegraph & Argus}} and Davies also urged Wells to remain with the club,{{cite web|url=http://www.thetelegraphandargus.co.uk/sport/sportbcfc/10857668.Davies__Wells_can_achieve_ambitions_staying_at_Bradford_City/|title=Andrew Davies: Nahki Wells can achieve ambitions staying at Bradford City|date=6 December 2013|accessdate=8 December 2013|author=Simon Parker|publisher=Telegraph & Argus}} while manager Phil Parkinson said that he did not want the club to sell the player.{{cite web|url=http://www.thetelegraphandargus.co.uk/sport/sportbcfc/10878682.I_m_hoping_for_an_offer_we_can_refuse__Bantams_boss_keeping_his_fingers_crossed_no_mega_bucks_bids_come_in_for_Wells/|title=I'm hoping for an offer we can refuse! Bantams boss keeping his fingers crossed no mega-bucks bids come in for Nahki Wells|date=16 December 2013|accessdate=17 December 2013|author=Simon Parker|publisher=Telegraph & Argus}} Wells picked up an injury at the end of December 2013,{{cite web|url=http://www.thetelegraphandargus.co.uk/sport/sportbcfc/10904645.Bradford_City_hopeful_on_Wells_injury/|title=Bradford City hopeful on Wells injury|date=30 December 2013|accessdate=2 January 2014|author=Simon Parker|publisher=Telegraph & Argus}} and at the start of the January 2014 transfer window, manager Phil Parkinson said he wanted any transfer issues sorted quickly.{{cite web|url=http://www.thetelegraphandargus.co.uk/sport/sportbcfc/10908244.I_don___t_want_to_play_waiting_game_over_Wells_in_transfer_window__says_Bradford_City_boss/|title=Nahki Wells in transfer window, says Bradford City boss Phil Parkinson|date=2 January 2014|accessdate=2 January 2014|author=Simon Parker|publisher=Telegraph & Argus}} The next day, 3 January 2014, the club announced that they had already rejected one offer for the player,{{cite web|url=http://www.thetelegraphandargus.co.uk/sport/sportbcfc/10911090.Bradford_City_refuse_first_Wells_offer/|title=Bradford City refuse first January offer for Nahki Wells|date=3 January 2014|accessdate=3 January 2014|author=Simon Parker|publisher=Telegraph & Argus}} after saying that Wells has been receiving interest from a number of [[Premier League]] clubs,{{cite web|url=http://www.thetelegraphandargus.co.uk/sport/sportbcfc/10919235.Bradford_City_striker_Wells_attracting_Premier_interest/|title=Bradford City striker Nahki Wells attracting Premier interest|date=8 January 2014|accessdate=8 January 2014|author=Simon Parker|publisher=Telegraph & Argus}} as well as Championship side Burnley.{{cite web|url=http://www.thetelegraphandargus.co.uk/sport/sportbcfc/10922609.Burnley_latest_club_to_be_linked_with_Bradford_City_hot_shot_Wells/|title=Burnley latest club to be linked with Bradford City hot-shot Nahki Wells|date=9 January 2014|accessdate=9 January 2014|author=Simon Parker|publisher=Telegraph & Argus}} The club also said they would lose £1 million for the 2013–14 season if they did not sell Wells.{{cite web|url=http://www.thetelegraphandargus.co.uk/sport/sportbcfc/10913274.Nahki_Wells_future_a_dilemma_for_Bradford_City_finances/|title=Nahki Wells future a dilemma for Bradford City finances|date=4 January 2014|accessdate=5 January 2014|author=Simon Parker|publisher=Telegraph & Argus}} Despite all the speculation, Parkinson said he felt Wells would be able to ignore off-the-field matters and concentrate on his playing,{{cite web|url=http://www.thetelegraphandargus.co.uk/sport/sportbcfc/10914932.Parkinson_sure_in_demand_Wells_will_not_let_Bradford_City_down/|title=Phil Parkinson sure in-demand Nahki Wells will not let Bradford City down|date=6 January 2014|accessdate=7 January 2014|author=Simon Parker|publisher=Telegraph & Argus}} though he later admitted that the player was being affected by the rumours.{{cite web|url=http://www.thetelegraphandargus.co.uk/sport/sportbcfc/10927726.Bradford_City_boss_says_speculation_affecting_Nahki_Wells/|title=Bradford City boss Phil Parkinson says speculation affecting form of Nahki Wells|date=10 January 2014|accessdate=10 January 2014|author=Simon Parker|publisher=Telegraph & Argus}} ===Huddersfield Town=== On 10 January 2014, Wells signed a four-and-a-half-year contract with [[Huddersfield Town A.F.C.|Huddersfield Town]] after transferring for an undisclosed club record fee.{{cite web|url=http://www.htafc.com/news/article/first-team-news-nahki-wells-signs-1286689.aspx|title=TERRIERS SIGN WELLS|date=10 January 2014|accessdate=10 January 2014|publisher=Huddersfield Town A.F.C.}}{{cite web|url=http://www.bradfordcityfc.co.uk/news/article/wells-moves-to-huddersfield-town-1285097.aspx|title=Wells moves to Huddersfield|date=10 January 2014|accessdate=10 January 2014|publisher=Bradford City A.F.C.}} The deal was initially completed a one-game loan deal, to allow time for the paperwork for the permanent move to be completed.{{cite web|url=http://www.thetelegraphandargus.co.uk/sport/sportbcfc/10928586.Huddersfield_boss_plays_down_Wells_transfer_talk/|title=UPDATED: Wells joins Huddersfield from Bradford City|date=10 January 2014|accessdate=10 January 2014|author=Simon Parker|publisher=Telegraph & Argus}}{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/25682217|title=Transfer window: Huddersfield sign Bradford's Nahki Wells|date=10 January 2014|accessdate=10 January 2014|publisher=BBC Sport}} Wells was criticised by a section for moving from Bradford City to a team considered a rival.{{cite web|url=http://www.thetelegraphandargus.co.uk/sport/sportbcfc/10930446.Bradford_City_fans_urged_to_respect_departing_Wells____ambition/|title=Bradford City fans urged to respect departing Nahki Wells' ambition|date=11 January 2014|accessdate=12 January 2014|author=Simon Parker|publisher=Telegraph & Argus}} On 11 January 2014, Wells made his Huddersfield Town debut, appearing as a substitute in the 55th minute, and scoring the winning goal in a 1–0 home victory against [[Millwall F.C.|Millwall]], less than 24 hours after joining the club.{{cite web|url=http://www.yorkshirepost.co.uk/sport/football/huddersfield/huddersfield-1-millwall-0-wells-nets-winner-on-debut-1-6367394|title=Huddersfield 1 Millwall 0: Wells nets winner on debut|date=11 January 2014|accessdate=12 January 2014|publisher=Yorkshire Post}}{{cite web|url=http://www.thetelegraphandargus.co.uk/sport/sportbcfc/10931519.Robins_hails__absolute_snip__Nahki_Wells__winning_strike/|title=Mark Robins hails 'absolute snip' Nahki Wells' winning strike|date=13 January 2014|accessdate=13 January 2014|publisher=Telegraph & Argus}} Wells ended his first full-season with Huddersfield Town as the club's top scorer with 14 goals.{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/teams/huddersfield-town/top-scorers|title=Top Scorers – Huddersfield Town – Football|website=BBC Sport}} At the end of the 2016–17 season, former club Bradford City received a £250,000 bonus payment following Huddersfield's promotion to the Premier League.{{cite web|url=http://www.thetelegraphandargus.co.uk/sport/sportbcfc/15278097.Wells_windfall_waits_for_Bantams___if_Huddersfield_go_up/|title=Wells windfall waits for Bantams – if Huddersfield go up|website=Bradford Telegraph and Argus}} ===Burnley=== Wells, in the final year of his contract with Huddersfield, signed a three-year deal with [[Burnley F.C.|Burnley]] for £5 million on 31 August 2017.{{cite web|last1=Ferrington|first1=Juliette|title=Nahki Wells: Burnley sign striker from Huddersfield|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/41098534|website=BBC Sport|accessdate=31 August 2017|date=31 August 2017}} ===Queens Park Rangers=== On 23 August 2018, Wells signed for [[EFL Championship|Championship]] side [[Queens Park Rangers F.C.|Queens Park Rangers]] on a season-long loan.{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/45286047|title=QPR: Brighton's Tomer Hemed and Burnley's Nahki Wells join on loan|date=23 August 2018|accessdate=24 August 2018|publisher=BBC Sport}} He scored his first goal for QPR against [[Sheffield Wednesday]] on 23 October 2018. ==International career== Wells made his international debut for [[Bermuda national football team|Bermuda]] in 2007. Wells also made four unofficial international appearances for Bermuda in the [[International Island Games Association|2007 Island Games]].{{cite web|url=http://www.rhodesresults2007.com/Competitor.aspx?RegID=9486|title=Nahki Wells|accessdate=21 December 2010|publisher=NatWest Island Games XII}} In late August 2011, Wells was recalled by Bermuda, joining their squad for FIFA World Cup qualifying matches in early September 2011.{{cite web|url=http://www.bradfordcityfc.co.uk/page/News/0,,10266~2429353,00.html|title=Wells given Bermuda call up|accessdate=23 August 2011|date=23 August 2011|publisher=Bradford City A.F.C.|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120905185218/http://www.bradfordcityfc.co.uk/page/News/0,,10266~2429353,00.html|archivedate=5 September 2012|df=dmy-all}} Wells appeared in five 2014 FIFA World Cup qualifying matches for Bermuda,{{FIFA player|295034}} against [[Barbados national football team|Barbados]], [[Guyana national football team|Guyana]] and [[Trinidad and Tobago national football team|Trinidad and Tobago]]. Wells was described as "one of Bermuda's most promising players, with an exceptionally bright future" in February 2012 by then Sports Minister [[Glenn Blakeney]],{{cite web|url=http://www.thetelegraphandargus.co.uk/sport/sportbcfc/9514779.Wells_doing_his_bit_for_club_and_country/|title=Bradford City striker Nahki Wells happy to be role model if it helps develop Bermuda football|date=7 February 2012|author=Simon Parker|work=Telegraph & Argus}} and was honoured by Premier [[Craig Cannonier]] in June 2013.{{cite web|url=http://www.thetelegraphandargus.co.uk/sport/sportbcfc/10464826.Wells_honoured_for_Bradford_City_exploits/|title=Nahki Wells honoured after Bradford City exploits|date=5 June 2013|author=Ross Heppenstall|work=Telegraph & Argus}} He has been described as the country's "star footballer".{{cite web|url=http://www.thetelegraphandargus.co.uk/sport/sportbcfc/10916913.Bermuda_crazy_for_news_of_Bradford_City_striker_Wells/|title=Bermuda crazy for news of Bradford City striker Nahki Wells|date=7 January 2014|accessdate=7 January 2014|author=Simon Parker|publisher=Telegraph & Argus}} ==Career statistics== ===Club=== {{updated|match played 2 March 2019}} {| class=wikitable style="text-align: center;" |+ Appearances and goals by club, season and competition |- !rowspan=2|Club !rowspan=2|Season !colspan=3|League !colspan=2|[[FA Cup]] !colspan=2|[[EFL Cup|League Cup]] !colspan=2|Other ||[[2019–20 CONCACAF Nations League qualifying|2019–20 CONCACAF Nations League qualification]] |} ==Honours== '''Bradford City''' *[[Football League Two play-offs]]: [[2013 Football League play-offs#League Two|2013]] *[[Football League Cup]] runner-up: [[2012–13 Football League Cup|2012–13]] '''Huddersfield Town''' *[[EFL Championship play-offs]]: [[2017 English Football League play-offs#Championship|2017]]{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/39995791 |title=Huddersfield Town 0–0 Reading |first=Ian |last=Woodcock |publisher=BBC Sport |date=29 May 2017 |accessdate=26 May 2018}} ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== {{commons category}} *[https://www.burnleyfootballclub.com/teams/first-team/forward/nahki-wells/ Nahki Wells profile] at the Burnley F.C. website *{{Soccerbase}} {{Huddersfield Town A.F.C.
